item.text:
Prohibit Auto Insurance Discrimination Act

This bill prohibits an automobile insurer from considering a consumer's education level, occupation, employment status, home ownership status, credit score, consumer report, previous insurer, or prior purchase of insurance when determining the consumer's insurance rates or eligibility.
item.name: Introduced in House

item.title: To prohibit private passenger automobile insurers from using certain income proxies to determine insurance rates and eligibility.

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: Prohibit Auto Insurance Discrimination Act

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 59 (Thursday, April 12, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. WATSON COLEMAN:H.R. 5502.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, section 8, clause 3 of the United StatesConstitution and Article 1, section 8, clause 18 of theUnited States Constitution____________________[Page H3210]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
